definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
please don't be upset/no hard feelings/absit iniuria verbis/let injury by words be absent

sentences.english: If anything i said displeased you , please do not take it ill.
sentences.chinese: 如果我哪句話說得不中聽，請別見怪。

sentences.english: Mr and Mrs Musgrove cannot think it wrong while I remain with him.
sentences.chinese: 有我守着他，默斯格羅夫夫婦不會見怪的。

sentences.english: We have become desensitized to Satan's evil plans.
sentences.chinese: 我們已見怪不怪，以撒旦的邪惡計劃。

sentences.english: We had become accustomed to the hypocrisy.
sentences.chinese: 對於僞善行爲我們已經見怪不怪了。

sentences.english: The Lan Hui was alsooffended fish to after entering water also slowly and longly return four elder brother that.
sentences.chinese: 瀾惠見怪魚進水後也慢悠悠的返回了四阿哥那。

sentences.english: I imagined it was some importunate person who-I beg you will excuse me.
sentences.chinese: 我還以爲是什麼人無故前來糾纏，望勿見怪。

sentences.english: I’d like to give you a little extra.
sentences.chinese: 我只能給你小小的意思一下，不要見怪。

sentences.english: I beg your pardon; -- one knows exactly what to think.
sentences.chinese: 說句你不見怪的話，人家完全知道該怎麼樣想法。
